positions.description:
DEVELOP and establish quality assurance measures and testing standards for new applications, products and/or enhancements to existing applications throughout their development/product lifestyles. Test new software development, enhancements, and existing functionality, reporting all defects with high customer impact prior to deployment.

â¢	COLLABORATE with analysts, designers and programmers in the testing of new software programs and applications
â¢	ANALYZE formal test results in order to discover and resolve defects, bugs and errors

positions.title: Software Test Engineer

positions.description:
* Provides operations management, consulting expertise and strategic technical knowledge of the Recruit Sustainment Program to 54 senior leader clients in 54 states and territories through organizational assessment design and metric analysis; improves business processes in support of the onboarding experiences, performance and retainment of 350,000 Department of Defense employees  

* Extensive interfacing with organization Senior Level Management, various Agencies and other stakeholders in all 54 states and territories to provide Leadership, Guidance and Strategy relating to Planning, Organizing and Developing Programs, Policies and Procedures, while also facilitating and conducting Senior level meetings and advising on specific geographical matters for local and national Process Improvements.

* Monitor, Oversee and Analyze the data collection procedures and practices of a National Quality Control team that achieves a QC rate of 98% on shipper packets. 

*Manage/Coordinate Administrative Compliance and Training standards of 320 National training sites funded for $18.5M annually that achieves an attrition rate of 3.5% lower than all other military components. 

* Identify, develop and articulate key solutions and recommendations to improve annual organizational training requirements for 38,000 military personnel; maintaining 100% compliance with Department of Defense policy.

* Provide curriculum oversight to monitor, evaluate, grant access and approve modifications to a comprehensive training data and case management application for over 38,000 trainees and 10,000 database users that results in over 26,000 annually trained soldiers.
positions.location: National Guard Bureau, Washington D.C. Metro Area
positions.title: Operations Manager/ Program Advisor

positions.description:
* Managed and provided oversight for the training and development of 15,000 Department of Defense employees and consulted Senior Management on complex issues while providing solutions and delivering excellent results; 47% decrease in training discharges over a 3 year period 
* Provided monthly statistical data for report preparation and advised, trained, and developed all Senior Staff on policies and procedures resulting in over 35,000 trained soldiers
ï	
* Investigated customer complaints, interpreted and briefed regulatory policy, employee benefits, reemployment rights and contracts to over 7,500 personnel to include Senior Management resulting in a 98% compliance rate
positions.title: Liaison Representative/Solutions Advisor

positions.description:
* Interviewed, contacted and advised over 6000 civilian and prior service personnel to obtain applicants for enlistment. Retained  qualified soldiers, conducted attrition management analysis, utilized market research analysis, implemented market strategy techniques, performed background investigations/checks, reviewed/screened court documents and conferred with judicial personnel to determine adjudications of legal findings and consistently achieved 100% of recruiting goals.

* Legally and morally screened over 2000 applicants/soldiers, prepared contracts and conducted school programs and presentations in high schools and colleges to introduce the benefits and rewards of Army National Guard membership.

* Designed, Staffed, Implemented and Facilitated an Education Program to assist applicants in Enhancing Academic Core Competencies to make realistic career and educational decisions and meet military eligibility standards for enlistment.
positions.title: Talent Acquisition Specialist/Production Recruiter

positions.companyName: U.S. Marine Corps & U.S. Marine Corps Reserve
positions.description:
* Responsible for transporting high value products and equipment as well as personnel to various facilities and locations throughout the organization chain utilizing vehicles up to 30 tons including 44 passenger buses.
 	
* Organized, coordinated and loaded supplies in preparation for delivery, while also maintaining and inspecting transportation equipment. Delivered heavy construction equipment valued in excess of several hundred thousand dollars.
 	
* Trained and instructed infantry students on the tactical and operational aspects of  light transportation vehicles and evaluated student performance in written assignments and classroom instruction to improve performance.
positions.title: Motor Vehicle/Tractor Trailer Operator and Instructor
